title: Approval of a centre to offer SQA qualifications (Scotland)

details.licence_overview:
If you run an education or training establishment and you wish to offer courses which lead to qualifications by the Scottish Qualifications Authority (SQA), you must be approved by the SQA.

You must apply for centre approval and approval to offer your first specific qualification at the same time.

Contact the SQA Business Development and Customer Support Team:

Telephone: 0303 333 0330

They will answer your initial queries and arrange for a Business Development Manager to contact you to advise on the viability of your proposal to become an approved centre and to provide you with a combined centre and qualification form.

In order to complete the application form you should consider whether:

  • an appropriate member of staff has been appointed as SQA co-ordinator
  • you can provide details of your organisation’s structure, with lines of responsibility and support for both staff and candidates, and show how this relates to the delivery of SQA qualifications
  • your administrative support is adequate
  • you have a procedure or plan to ensure adequate numbers of trainers, assessors and internal verifiers for the anticipated number of candidates

You should return your completed application form with your:

  • completed Financial Status Enquiry Consent form
  • appeals procedure for candidates
  • equal opportunities policy
  • health and safety policy
  • internal verification procedures

You should also include, if appropriate:

  • your site selection checklist
  • awarding body letter of approval

It’s likely that a Quality Enhancement Manager will then visit your centre, complete a report on the systems you have in place and let you know if you meet the requirements to allow your centre to offer SQA qualifications. Written confirmation will be provided to your SQA co-ordinator within one week of the visit.

You must also obtain approval to offer your initial qualification before you will receive a centre number.
